body_html:
I run my TF scripts as tf.sh myscript.py

Where tf.sh is

python $* 3>&1 1>&2 2>&3 3>&- | grep -v ":\ I\ " | grep -v "WARNING:tensorflow" | grep -v ^pciBusID | grep -v ^major: | grep -v ^name: |grep -v ^Total\ memory:|grep -v ^Free\ memory:

When something annoys me, I add another "grep -v" clause.
Getting rid of "Tensorflow was compiled without SSE" messages by default would reduce number of complains about too many useless messages, and increase number of complains about TensorFlow being too slow.

When something annoys me, I add another "grep -v" clause.
Getting rid of "Tensorflow was compiled without SSE" messages by default would reduce number of complains about too many useless messages, and increase number of complains about TensorFlow being too slow.
body:
I run my TF scripts as `tf.sh myscript.py`

Where tf.sh is

`python $* 3>&1 1>&2 2>&3 3>&- | grep -v ":\ I\ " | grep -v "WARNING:tensorflow" | grep -v ^pciBusID | grep -v ^major: | grep -v ^name: |grep -v ^Total\ memory:|grep -v ^Free\ memory:`

When something annoys me, I add another "grep -v" clause.
Getting rid of "Tensorflow was compiled without SSE" messages by default would reduce number of complains about too many useless messages, and increase number of complains about TensorFlow being too slow.
